elements.title: Karađorđeva šnicla (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Karađorđeva šnicla (pictured) was accidentally created as an improvisation of chicken Kiev?

elements.title: Joan McIntyre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that activist Joan McIntyre left Friends of the Earth to start her own organization focused on stopping Japanese and Russian whaling?

elements.title: Love Lies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sandra Ng wore her own clothes while filming Love Lies to help the production crew save on the budget?

elements.title: a former textile factory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the world's largest video game studio is headquartered in a former textile factory?

elements.title: Abramo Colorni (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Renaissance-era weapons designer Abramo Colorni performed magical illusions and card tricks for his patrons?

elements.title: Happy of the End (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ogeretsu Tanaka was inspired to create the manga series Happy of the End after taking a morning walk in Shinjuku?

elements.title: Kitsap (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1825 the Suquamish leader Kitsap led an alliance of tribes stretching from the Columbia River to Puget Sound to stop the Cowichan slave raids wreaking havoc on the Sound?

elements.title: a defamation lawsuit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a judge is threatening to shut down Wikipedia in India over a defamation lawsuit?

elements.title: a South Dakota radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a South Dakota radio station went from a university to "Guns, Gold & Rock 'n' Roll"?
